tutorial.title: Computing Payment, Interest, and Loan Balance After a Specified Payment
tutorial.scenario:
A group of sellers considers financing the sale price of a property for $200,000 at 6% annual interest, amortized over 30-year term with a balloon payment due after five years. They want to know:

  • Amount of the monthly payment
  • Amount of interest they will receive
  • Remaining balance at the end of the term (i.e., the balloon payment)

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 360, since the loan is for 30 years), and then press the N button.
Enter the periodic interest rate (in this case 6/12, since payments are made on a monthly basis), and then press the = button followed by the I/Y button.
Enter the loan amount (in this case 200000), and then press the PV button.
Press the CPT button and then the PMT button to solve for the monthly payment.
tutorial.part: Part 2. Generate an amortization schedule for the interest and balloon payment.
tutorial.step: Press the AMORT button to access the amortization worksheet.
Press ↓, enter 60 (since the balloon payment is due after five years), and then press the ENTER button to set the ending period to 60.
Press ↓ to display the balance after five years (the balloon payment).
Press ↓↓ to display the interest paid after five years.
